A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I've never posted a review on Rotten Tomatoes\, but I feel obligated to support this film's audience rating given the groupthink panning that seems to have taken off. I thoroughly enjoyed the film\, especially the deeper character development of Kylo & Rey\, & the tense relationship that emerged between them. And kudos for the original script (compared with the lazy rehashing of the plots of IV & V in The Force Awakens). These new films are never going to be the Skywalker fairy tales of the original line-up -- nor should they be -- so get over it\, fellow fans. And let's be thankful that they're not the pathetically scripted prequels with poorly cast Anakin\, which still irks me (so disappointing). I'd rank this as one of the top four Star Wars alongside IV & V.
